How to install lookbusy 1.4.  A tool used to generate synthetic CPU load among other functions:

1. extract lookbusy-1.4.tar.gz into some directory
2. cd into the extracted directory
3. run the configuration file by using './configure'
4. send a 'make' command
5. send a 'make install' command
6. simple CPU loading is done with 'lookbusy -c <percentage of load>'
7. for more advanced commands use 'lookbusy --help'
8. enjoy some more coffee (unless you don't drink coffee, at which point you should probably have that looked at by a medical professional)
